MatchedRegions.transcript: Our method can be seen in the upper figure.

MatchedRegions.transcript: Features of the source and target domain are aligned by cluster prototypes.
To cluster memory bank features into prototypes, we build upon PCS and perform spherical k-means with a momentum of 0.5.

MatchedRegion.Text: We build upon PCS [8] and perform in-domain contrastive learning and cross-domain self-supervised learning via cluster prototypes
Memory bank features are updated with a momentum of 0.5
Spherical K-means [9] (K=2500) is used to cluster memory bank features into prototypes

MatchedRegions.transcript: Similar to PCS, we perform in-domain contrastive learning and cross-domain self-supervised learning between the features of the feature extractor and the prototypes.

MatchedRegion.Text: We build upon PCS [8] and perform in-domain contrastive learning and cross-domain self-supervised learning via cluster prototypes

[8] X. Yue, Z. Zheng, S. Zhang, Y. Gao, T. Darrell, K. Keutzer, and A. Sangiovanni-Vincentelli "Prototypical Cross-domain Self-supervised Learning for Few-shot Unsupervised Domain Adaptation," " in Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), June 2021. [9] J. Johnson, M. Douze, and H. Jégou, "Billion-scale similarity search with GPUs," IEEE Transactions on Big Data, vol. 7, no. 3, pp. 535-547 2019.

MatchedRegions.transcript: To further improve performance, we add our pseudo-loss formulation for grid-based lane detection.

MatchedRegion.Text: Our objective function comprises the in-domain and cross-domain losses from PCS, all losses from UFLD, and our pseudo loss for grid-based lane detection

MatchedRegions.transcript: Overall, our objective function comprises the in-domain and cross-domain losses from PCS, all losses from UFLD and all

MatchedRegion.Text: Our objective function comprises the in-domain and cross-domain losses from PCS, all losses from UFLD, and our pseudo loss for grid-based lane detection
